intro: Coprosma waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea coprosma, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface. Coprosma waimeae is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streambanks.
